channel.title: 508 Help!
channel.description:
Hi, this is a pretty easy Question to Answer, but, i'm having trouble with some of my integers (ints). Take a look below:
I have this code, in my Engine Class:
[b]Public int BackupTimer = -1;[/b]
Then I have this code, in the Login Class:
[b]Engine.BackupTimer = 240;[/b]
And again, I have this code in my Engine Class:
[b]If (BackupTimer > 0) { BackupTimer--;[/b]
What the code is suppose to do is take 1 away from the timer, every second (Or for milleseconds, it will take 2 away every second). [b]Example:[/b] If I set the timer for 30 seconds, the code will pretty much make it into a timer like system, causing the 30 seconds to deduct slowly until reached 1. Ex: 30, 29, 28, 27, until it reaches 1, thus making a timer.
However, it just stays to the Paramitive Value, which is 240, the timer doesn't start, even though I program it to otherwise.
Help?

item.title: 508 Help!
item.dc:creator: @Lord_of_fallen_Angel Lord of fallen Angels
item.description:
@Lord_of_fallen_Angel wrote:

Hi, this is a pretty easy Question to Answer, but, i’m having trouble with some of my integers (ints). Take a look below:

I have this code, in my Engine Class:

Public int BackupTimer = -1;

Then I have this code, in the Login Class:

Engine.BackupTimer = 240;

And again, I have this code in my Engine Class:

If (BackupTimer > 0) {
BackupTimer–;

What the code is suppose to do is take 1 away from the timer, every second (Or for milleseconds, it will take 2 away every second). Example: If I set the timer for 30 seconds, the code will pretty much make it into a timer like system, causing the 30 seconds to deduct slowly until reached 1. Ex: 30, 29, 28, 27, until it reaches 1, thus making a timer.

However, it just stays to the Paramitive Value, which is 240, the timer doesn’t start, even though I program it to otherwise.

Help?

Read full topic
